Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.generic

Class SortWithHelperAndAdditionalMemory<X>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.generic.SortWithHelper<X>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.classic.ClassificationSorter<X,Integer>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.generic.SortWithHelperAndAdditionalMemory<X>
Type Parameters:
X - underlying type which extends Comparable.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Classifier<X,Integer>, HasAdditionalMemory, ProcessingSort<X>, Sort<X>, AutoCloseable
Direct Known Subclasses:
MSDStringSort
public abstract class SortWithHelperAndAdditionalMemory<X> extends ClassificationSorter<X,Integer> implements HasAdditionalMemory
Base class for Sort with a non-comparable Helper.

  • Constructor Details

    • SortWithHelperAndAdditionalMemory

      public SortWithHelperAndAdditionalMemory(Helper<X> helper, BiFunction<X,Integer,Integer> classifier)
      Constructor for SortWithHelperAndAdditionalMemory, initializing with a helper and classifier function.
      Parameters:
      helper - an instance of Helper that provides utilities for sorting.
      classifier - a BiFunction that associates each element of type X with an Integer classification.

    • SortWithHelperAndAdditionalMemory

      public SortWithHelperAndAdditionalMemory(String description, BiFunction<X,Integer,Integer> classifier, Comparator<X> comparator, int N, int nRuns, Config config)
      Constructor for SortWithHelperAndAdditionalMemory that initializes the sort with a specified description, classifier function, comparator, number of elements, number of runs, and configuration settings. This constructor relies on a helper created using the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      description - A string describing the sorting algorithm or its configuration.
      classifier - A BiFunction that maps an element of type X and an integer to an Integer classification value.
      comparator - A comparator to define the order of elements during sorting.
      N - The total number of elements to be sorted.
      nRuns - The number of runs for testing or measurement purposes.
      config - Configuration settings related to the sorting process.

  • Method Details

    • setArrayMemory

      public void setArrayMemory(int n)
      Sets the array memory capacity for the sorting process. If the current array memory is uninitialized (-1), this method initializes it to the specified value and adjusts the additional memory used accordingly.
      Specified by:
      setArrayMemory in interface HasAdditionalMemory
      Parameters:
      n - the amount of memory to allocate for the array.

    • additionalMemory

      public void additionalMemory(int n)
      Updates the additional memory allocation for sorting and adjusts the maximum memory used.
      Specified by:
      additionalMemory in interface HasAdditionalMemory
      Parameters:
      n - the amount of memory to increase, added to the current additional memory.

    • getMemoryFactor

      public Double getMemoryFactor()
      Calculates the memory factor as the ratio of the maximum memory allowed to the currently set array memory.
      Specified by:
      getMemoryFactor in interface HasAdditionalMemory
      Returns:
      the memory factor as a Double. If the array memory has not been set (value is -1), this method throws a SortException.
      Throws:
      SortException - if the array memory has not been set prior to calling this method.

    • getLogger

      public LazyLogger getLogger()

      Overrides:

      Returns:
      the LazyLogger instance used for logging.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes resources associated with the sorting process and logs memory usage.

      This method invokes super.close() to release resources at the base level. It then calculates the memory factor by utilizing the getMemoryFactor() method, which provides a ratio of maximum memory used to the allocated array memory. The result is logged at the INFO level for analysis or debugging purposes.

      Preconditions: - Array memory must be set prior to invoking this method; otherwise, a SortException will be thrown by getMemoryFactor().

      Postconditions: - The superclass close behavior is executed. - The memory factor is logged.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Sort<X>
      Overrides:
      close in class SortWithHelper<X>
